result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Thomas Molenkamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: TIME SERVED.  Huber privileges granted consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Thomas Molenkamp

Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Defendant Michael Thomas Molenkamp via video from Winnebago County Jail and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran in person.  Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Resolution reached.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  (Defense counsel provided with notice of right to seek postconviction relief form to obtain defendant's signature and return to the Court for filing)
AMENDED NOTICE:  10-03-2022 Hearing reset on same date from 2:30 to 2:00 p.m. to accommodate video appearance from Winnebago County Jail.
22R 015500 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15917 on 8-4-22

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael Thomas Molenkamp in custody via video and by Attorney Edgar A Beltran.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Edgar Beltran via video.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  State requests cash bond.  Argument on bond.  Defendant is on a PO hold.  $250 cash bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with appointed counsel.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
